slides.title: Humble Beginnings
slides.content: Born from the F-Series in 1948, the F-150 launched in 1975 to meet changing needs—more capability and durability without sacrificing efficiency.
slides.imagery: Left: sepia 1950s F-Series hauling on a farm road; Right: early F-150 (1970s) in color on gravel, both tack-sharp

slides.title: Key Figures

henry_ford.name: Henry Ford
background: Founded Ford Motor Company (1903) and pioneered the moving assembly line
Pushed practical vehicles for workers, farmers, and small businesses
Set a culture of making durability and value accessible
henry_ford.quote: Coming together is a beginning; keeping together is progress; working together is success.

lee_iacocca.name: Lee Iacocca
background: Ford President (1970s) who broadened truck appeal beyond the jobsite
Championed customer-focused features and comfort without losing capability
Helped guide F-Series positioning during the F-150’s pivotal early years
lee_iacocca.quote: You can have brilliant ideas, but if you can’t get them across, your ideas won’t get you anywhere.

slides.slide_design: Two-column layout with executive portraits above bios

slides.title: F-Series Origins

content.description: The F-150 arrived in 1975 as a tougher, heavier-duty successor to the F-100, blending work-ready strength with daily comfort. It quickly became the heart of the F-Series lineup.
content.milestone_vehicle: 1975 F-150 | higher GVWR and payload, setting the template for modern full-size pickups

slides.imagery: Image caption: First-generation F-150 (1975) in Wimbledon White, front three-quarter, clean studio lighting

slides.title: Becoming an Icon

content.description: For decades, F-Series has led U.S. pickup sales—trusted by trades, families, and fleets for capability and value.

slides.slide_design: Big-number overlay on a chrome grille texture

slides.title: Powering Ahead
slides.content: Innovation keeps the F-150 in front: EcoBoost turbo power (2011), high-strength aluminum-alloy body (2015), hybrid PowerBoost (2021), and the all-electric F-150 Lightning (2022).
slides.imagery: Collage: turbo engine close-up, aluminum body panel stamping, hybrid badge macro, Lightning charging at dusk—clean, high-contrast

slides.title: Major Marketing Campaigns

campaigns.description: A simple promise of durability and grit that defined the truck category.
Rounded design and improved comfort brought more buyers into the fold.
Proved twin-turbo power with extreme lab, worksite, and desert endurance stories.
Showcased strength and weight savings with towing, payload, and durability demos.
Celebrated owners, communities, and American manufacturing with refreshed brand voice.
Introduced electric capability, home-backup power, and smart tech to new audiences.

slides.slide_design: Timeline layout with key campaigns highlighted by year and short proof points

slides.title: Recap: The Evolution of F-150
content: 1970s: F-150 debuts—tougher, more capable, broader appeal
1990s: Comfort and safety elevate everyday usability
2010s: EcoBoost power and aluminum body transform performance
Now: Hybrid and all-electric options push capability into the future
